snippet: By asking Congress for authorization to retaliate against Syria, President Obama has put himself at the mercy of an institution that has bedeviled his presidency for years.
abstract: Washington Memo; Pres Obama, by asking Congress for authorization to retaliate against Syria, has put himself at mercy of an institution that has bedeviled his presidency for years; as administration begins high-stakes lobbying effort for military action, early indications suggest that Syria debate will face version of paralyzing partisan politics that has repeatedly blocked Obama's past legislative proposals.
lead_paragraph: By asking Congress for authorization to retaliate against Syria, President Obama has put himself at the mercy of an institution that has bedeviled his presidency for years.

headline.print_headline: History Aside, Obama Bets On Congress
headline.main: History Aside, Obama Bets on Congress
